reviewText: As a fan of Nancy Drew games and mysteries, this has received a special spot on my favorites shelf. For starters, basing a game around a legend is pretty darn cool -- the skull itself was a beautiful work of art. The puzzles in this game have really been stepped up to a challenging level. Even on junior sleuth, the puzzles are quite challenging, almost as if you were playing as a senior detective. Not to mention, the entire locations and scenes in New Oreleans really adds to the entire story background and the mystery of this game. This is most certainly a game worth playing! Happy sleuthing!
voteText: 7 of 7 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
♥ So creepy!

I wasn't expecting how creepy the game would be until I hit the opening scene. This game, at least for me, is a lot more scary than the others despite it being one of the older titles. It deals with voodoo, rainy weather, exploring in a grave yard, etc. A bit too spooky for me!

♥ There's an iguana.

Gator. Tarantula too. Since I have exotic" animals myself (a bearded dragon
helpfulPercent: and interesting characters. I don't think I'll be finishing this
votesHelpful:
the  dummy in the attic was too much for me but I do want to know who did it...! It made me guess and guess and guess again.

✘ Steam overlay...

It may just be glitched for me but Steam overlay never worked when I played the game. I either had to play it windowed (too small to properly see anything) or have it in full screen and was unable to reply to messages. Not a huge deal
